page.title: 11Blythe Colours-Workforce
page.content:
Blythe Colours, a factory which makes colour for world wide customers, situated in Cresswell, seven miles south of Stoke-on-Trent has quite a large workforce for this area of about 550 people. Of these, 80 percent are men and 20 percent women. The age at which most people start work at Blythe Colours range from school-leavers to early twenties.
Training is available and day release is encouraged. To help with imports and exports, language training is also given.
A large proportion of the workers are "white-coated" ie laboratory staff. Only about 100 people are involved in prduction.
